projects.name: Lakeview
projects.description: Developed a modern website for a local bar & grill.

projects.name: NexaDB
projects.description: Built a website for a database company to streamline applicant management.

projects.name: MHS Laude

projects.name: Milton Relay

projects.name: Journey

technologies.name: NextJS
technologies.description: Next.js is a React framework that enables functionality such as server-side rendering and generating static websites for React applications. It is a powerful tool for building web applications.

technologies.name: Flutter
technologies.description: Flutter is an open-source UI software development kit created by Google. It is used to develop applications for Android, iOS, Linux, Mac, Windows, Google Fuchsia, and the web from a single codebase.

technologies.name: MongoDB
technologies.description: MongoDB is a NoSQL database program that uses JSON-like documents with optional schemas. It is a powerful tool for storing and managing data in web applications.

technologies.name: Java
technologies.description: Java is a high-level, class-based, object-oriented programming language that is designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible. It is a powerful tool for building web applications and server-side programs.

technologies.name: HTML
technologies.description: HTML is the standard markup language for creating web pages and web applications. It is a powerful tool for building user interfaces and displaying content on the web.

technologies.name: CSS
technologies.description: CSS is a style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in HTML. It is a powerful tool for styling web pages and creating visually appealing user interfaces.

technologies.name: JavaScript
technologies.description: JavaScript is a high-level, interpreted programming language that is used to create interactive effects within web browsers. It is a powerful tool for building dynamic web applications.

technologies.name: Python
technologies.description: Python is an interpreted, high-level, general-purpose programming language that is used for web development, data analysis, artificial intelligence, and scientific computing. It is a powerful tool for building web applications and server-side programs.

technologies.name: Git
technologies.description: Git is a distributed version control system that is used to track changes in source code during software development. It is a powerful tool for collaborating with other developers and managing codebases.

technologies.name: Kotlin
technologies.description: Kotlin is a cross-platform, statically typed programming language that is used to develop Android applications. It is a powerful tool for building mobile applications.

technologies.name: Firebase
technologies.description: Firebase is a mobile and web application development platform that is used to build, improve, and grow applications. It is a powerful tool for developing and deploying applications.

technologies.name: C++
technologies.description: C++ is a powerful general-purpose programming language known for its performance and efficiency. It supports both object-oriented and procedural programming paradigms, making it suitable for a wide range of applications, from system software to game development and large-scale applications.
